main event: Two round-shaped yellow lights, the size of a pinhead, flew in formation and then disappeared to the east while climbing in N.W. Washington, D.C. on 27 June 1956.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only 5-10 seconds, with a remarkably short duration.
The documents mention the presence of two objects and confirm that photographs were taken during the observation.
One witness, a civilian, reported the sighting, providing credibility to the report.
The text also includes a note about a bright disc-type object moving at aircraft speed over Washington at 1500 feet altitude, reported by a Captain Matthew C. Oliver, U.S.A.F.
The report suggests a conclusive safety conclusion, indicating a possible prosaic explanation for the event.
